articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: Treasury yields hit new decade highs in Asia on Tuesday as traders grew wary of how long interest rates might need to stay elevated, with the higher risk-free rate putting a dampener on stocks even as beaten-down Chinese markets attempted a rebound.
articles.title: Soaring yields leave stocks struggling for headway

articles.author: Saeed Azhar
articles.description: Goldman Sachs (GS.N) is weighing the sale of a part of its wealth business, it said on Monday, as it shifts its focus back to serving the ultra-rich and away from high-net-worth clients in mass markets.
articles.title: Goldman Sachs weighs sale of part of its wealth business

articles.author: Muyu Xu
articles.description: Oil edged lower on Tuesday as the market waited to see if Iraqi oil exports resume, which could ease the supply tightness caused by the OPEC+ cut, while a faltering Chinese economy continued to undercut the global demand outlook.
articles.title: Oil dips on possible easing of tight supply, China woes hurt  demand outlook

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Meta Platforms (META.O) will ask a court in Norway on Tuesday to stop a fine the country's data regulator has imposed on the owner of Facebook and Instagram for breaching users' privacy, in a case that could have wider European implications.
articles.title: Facebook owner Meta Platforms seeks to stop privacy breach fine in Norway

articles.author: David Milliken
articles.description: Britain has received a surge in job searches from overseas during the past year, partly reflecting a post-Brexit relaxation in work visa rules for non-European Union nationals, figures from recruitment website Indeed showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: UK sees surge in interest from non-EU job hunters

articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: A work of art created by artificial intelligence without any human input cannot be copyrighted under U.S. law, a U.S. court in Washington, D.C., has ruled.
articles.title: AI-generated art cannot receive copyrights, US court says

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Wells Fargo (WFC.N) won the dismissal of a lawsuit accusing the fourth-largest U.S. bank of defrauding shareholders by touting its commitment to hiring diversity while its managers were conducting sham interviews of non-white and female job candidates.
articles.title: Wells Fargo defeats shareholder lawsuit over fake job interviews

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan said on Tuesday it will start releasing more than 1 million metric tonnes of treated radioactive water from the wrecked Fukushima nuclear power plant on Aug. 24, putting into motion a plan that has drawn strong criticism from China.
articles.title: Japan to release Fukushima water into ocean starting Aug 24

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump plans to turn himself in and be processed in Atlanta on Thursday in connection with his indictment in Georgia, he said on social media on Monday.
articles.title: Trump plans to turn himself in on Thursday over Georgia indictment

articles.author: Ismael Lopez
articles.description: The Central American Parliament on Monday voted to expel Taiwan after more than two decades as a permanent observer and replace it with China, whose growing economic influence in Latin America has increasingly marginalized Taipei.
articles.title: Central America parliament expels Taiwan, makes China permanent observer
